segments.text: My attention keeps returning to the boy on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's so focused on those cookies, he doesn't seem to notice the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is definitely leaning; it looks like it could go any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost feel the wobble from here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: One wrong move, and he'll be tumbling backward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's got a plate in one hand, presumably to pile up his spoils.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That's not helping his balance at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister looks up at him with such trust, completely unaware of the peril.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could reach in and steady that stool for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The jar of cookies seems like such a tempting prize.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But it's not worth the risk of an injury.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: These children have no idea how close they are to a mishap.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole situation is just an accident waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone intervenes before it's too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
